Weâve enhanced the bodybuggSPâ¢ mobile app to help you monitor your workout in real-time.Enhanced dashboard thatâs easy to follow and lets you see current resultsScreen rotation to view results in graphsView workout history on previous dayâs resultsSet workout goals and track in real-time*The bodybugg Personal Calorie Management System includes 6 months online subscription. Online subscription renewal fees are: $9.95 for month to month, $49.95 for 6 months or $79.95 for 12 months.  BODYBUGG and BODYBUGGSP are trademarks owned by 24 Hour Fitness USA, Inc. reviews.title: Great when it works...sucks the life out if the battery.
reviews.comment: This app is pretty good when I can get it to working correctly. Sometimes it will pull up prior days other times it won\'t.  And sometimes it will show yesterday and sometimes it won\'t.  It seems to drain both the phone and bodybugg batteries. It also works differently on my husband\'s phone...and his is identical to mine.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Version 2.0 perfect!
reviews.comment: Thank you so much for updating this app.I have had a body bugg for 6 yrs and I love it more than ever works perfectly in my DROID x . love it!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good app but missing something
reviews.comment: I like this app, but I do not like how complicated it is to enter my calorie intake.  I would like to see a scanning feature that allows you to scan food in via the barcode.  That would make this app more user friendly and more accurate.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Second trial
reviews.comment: The updates have improved connectivity and navigating. Still missing some foods, but when syncing to computer can manually input nutrition facts to be more accurate.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Could be great, but...
reviews.comment: My phone won\'t connect to my armband (HTC thunderbolt). Its in paired but not connected status and I have yet to be able to get it to connect no matter what I do. Any tips?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Needs work...
reviews.comment: When it works, its ok but that is rare. it has problems with HTC phones mines evo shift. Force closing, won\'t link, and needs barcode scanner.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Review
reviews.comment: Can\'t recommend this product or app.  Won\'t link, continually unpairs, have to uninstall and reinstall too many times.  And logging food isn\'t easy.  Look at the Lose It! App if you want something you can REALLY use!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: It just does not work with any consistency. One day on, three days off. Haven\'t been able to log on for the last 2 days. Please fix!!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Mickey Mouse App
reviews.comment: Calories consumed doesn\'t work, calories burned wont show graph in landscape mode...should have way to upload data to website. No thought or testing.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It\'s ok
reviews.comment: When I track work out, it keeps stopping on me, I would like it to be be able to record the whole work out, other than great
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Why doesn\'t this app upload the data it receives to the body bugg servers.   So basically i can sync this to my body bugg, but i still have to sync it to my computer later if i want the information logged online.   Kinda defeats the purpose of it.\tAnd I can\'t manually enter calories for food eaten?   I have to go through your incomplete list and pick from it?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Free apps are better!
reviews.comment: The food log still sucks. Loose it is great you put in pop tart and 50 kinds pop up. Body bug is a paid app and zero come up. Get the food log on par
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: It downloaded just fine....BUT
reviews.comment: I downloaded this app to my Samsung Galaxy S II with no problems. I don\'t use it to sync my armband. I only want it on my phone so I can log my food while on the go. Unfortunately, the menus and links are in DARK GRAY - you can barely see them!! WHAT?!?! I would still like to see a better database for the food.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good in theory, but doesn\'t cut it
reviews.comment: Extremely long process to log food, which contradicts ease of use expected on a mobile device. Doesn\'t have all capabilities of logging new foods as on-line version does. My device (Fascinate) is currently paired but will not connect. Not sure why yet.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Needs improvement!
reviews.comment: It causes a force close a lot.  And I wish I could see the same activity graph as I do online.  Food entry is cumbersome.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Ok
reviews.comment: Great for logging most food.  Wish I could see more of the detailed info you get on the website
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: I\'m extremely frustrated with this app!!! It will not let me even log in. It says my username and/or password is incorrect when it is not!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Never sync\'s
reviews.comment: I have a horrible time syncing my body bugg ever since the upgrade! It totally sucks! The reason I paid extra was to be able to sync to my phone :(
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good overall
reviews.comment: I wish I could create a new food from my smart phone instead of having to do it on the computer.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: This app isn\'t all that great. I can never get my armband to connect to my phone. I have a MyTouch 3G Slide.
reviews.author: A Google User
